meanings.definition: To form a cartel or participate in a cartel.
meanings.sent1: The companies were cartelising to control the market.
meanings.sent2: The drug lords were cartelising to increase their profits.
meanings.sent3: The penguins were cartelising to monopolize the fish supply.
meanings.sent4: The students were cartelising their resources for the group project.
meanings.sent5: The ants were cartelising to gather food efficiently.

meanings.definition: The act of organizing or creating a cartel.
meanings.sent1: The cartelising of the oil industry led to price manipulation.
meanings.sent2: The government investigated the cartelising of the construction companies.
meanings.sent3: The cartoon depicted the funny side of cartelising among animals.
meanings.sent4: The artist used colors to represent the cartelising of different factions.
meanings.sent5: The history book detailed the cartelising of powerful families in the past.
